The Travis County program: announced in May 2010, allows individuals who have committed certain felony offenses to avoid prosecution by meeting specific conditions for a designated period of time.
The program is open to nonviolent: first-time felony offenders who do not have a history of drug addiction. Offenders must have no prior criminal record and must demonstrate a genuine desire to rectify their mistake.
Participants in the program sign a form: s office, outlining the terms they must fulfill for up to two years. These terms may include not being re-arrested, community service, counseling, and restitution payments.
